title: Is Ethereum Stock a Good Investment in 2022 - The Motley Fool
summary: Ethereum (ETH) is a decentralized, open-source technology that powers much of the crypto world. It's the second-largest cryptocurrency after Bitcoin (BTC) and has a growing use in various industries such as finance, logistics, and healthcare. The Ethereum Merge, a shift to a proof-of-stake system, is expected to make the technology remarkably more energy-efficient. Investors can buy Ethereum directly through a crypto exchange, stock broker, or payment app that carries it. Alternatively, they can invest in managed funds that invest in Ethereum for them or companies with large exposure to Ethereum technology. The best stocks to buy for Ethereum exposure include Grayscale Ethereum Trust, Bitwise Ethereum Fund, HIVE Blockchain, NVIDIA, and AMD. Investing in crypto assets themselves or companies betting on blockchain and crypto asset uptake is the best way to get exposure to the movement.

title: Bitcoin approaches $38,000 and Ethereum crosses $2,000 as ETF fever continues to buoy the crypto market - Fortune
summary: Bitcoin surged to a new high of $38,000 and Ethereum crossed $2,000 as crypto markets continue to rally. The total market capitalization for all cryptocurrencies has increased by 30% since October 9, driven by optimism around the approval of a spot Bitcoin ETF. BlackRock has registered the name "iShares Ethereum Trust" in Delaware, indicating that it may file a spot ether ETF application soon. The crypto industry is betting that the approval of a spot Bitcoin ETF would lead to significant capital inflows into the market. While the SEC has yet to approve a spot Bitcoin ETF, Bloomberg Intelligence analysts believe there is a 90% chance of approval by January.

title: Blackrock May Be Considering an Ether ETF, Ether Price Jumps - Investopedia
summary: Blackrock may be working on an Ether ETF, according to a recent filing in Delaware. The news caused the Ether price to spike by 7% before retracting some of those gains. This filing comes after Blackrock made a similar move for iShares Bitcoin Trust and applied for a spot Bitcoin ETF with the SEC. The possibility of a spot bitcoin ETF receiving approval has been a major focus in the crypto industry, with some analysts predicting an approval by January of next year. While futures-based Ether ETFs have been launched, a spot Ether ETF from Blackrock could have significant implications for the crypto asset's regulatory standing with the SEC.

summary:

Its vision is to decentralize the web and democratize application development, giving individuals control over their data and applications. Ethereum has implications for various industries, including finance, supply chain management, and healthcare. It aims to create a more inclusive and transparent digital world where everyone has a stake and a voice.

However, the SEC's previous hesitance to approve Bitcoin ETFs may cast uncertainty over BlackRock's Ethereum trust. The crypto community is closely watching these developments, along with Grayscale's court victory and BlackRock's entry into the market, as potential game-changers for the industry.

title: Ether surpasses $2,000 for first time since July as BlackRock registers iShares Ethereum Trust entity in Delaware - The Block
summary: Ether (ETH) surpassed $2,000 for the first time since July, driven by news of BlackRock's potential spot Ethereum ETF offering. The price jumped 7% on Thursday, with Bitcoin also seeing notable gains. Analysts attribute the rally to a possible spot ETF approval and positive macroeconomic factors, such as major U.S. indices posting multi-week gains and a shift in bitcoin market share from short-term to long-term holders. However, some caution against predicting approvals and note that markets are sensitive to spot ETF-related news.

title: Nasdaq files for BlackRock's proposed iShares Ethereum Trust ETF - The Block
summary:
Sure, here's a summary of the article in less than 256 tokens:

Nasdaq has filed for a proposed iShares Ethereum Trust ETF, according to a 19b-4 filing made by BlackRock. The ETF will use Coinbase Custody Trust Company as custodian and track the CME CF Ether-Dollar Reference Rate - New York Variant. This comes after BlackRock filed to register an entity in Delaware, indicating increased interest in crypto. The proposed ETF could take months to approve, and the SEC has delayed existing applications for proposed spot bitcoin funds multiple times.

title: BlackRock Confirms Plans for Ethereum Spot ETF With NASDAQ Filing, Sparks ETH Price Surge - Yahoo Finance
summary: BlackRock has filed a 19b-4 form with the SEC to launch a spot Ethereum exchange-traded fund (ETF), sparking a 11% surge in Ethereum's value. The filing was submitted on behalf of Nasdaq, indicating BlackRock's expansion into the Ethereum market after establishing the "iShares Ethereum Trust" entity in Delaware. This development follows previous attempts by other financial firms to secure SEC approval for spot Ethereum ETFs. The announcement has led to Ethereum regaining market dominance, currently standing at 18.1%.

title: BlackRock has filed to register a new iShares Ethereum Trust entity in Delaware - The Block
summary: BlackRock, the world's largest asset manager, has filed to register a new iShares Ethereum Trust entity in Delaware. This filing suggests that BlackRock may be expanding its crypto offerings, following its recent bitcoin ETF application with the Securities and Exchange Commission (SEC). The iShares Ethereum Trust filing has been made with the Delaware Department of State Division of Corporations, and the SEC has not yet commented on the matter. BlackRock's bitcoin ETF application is currently awaiting a decision from the SEC, and the company's CEO has stated that a rally in the price of bitcoin triggered by a false news report of its ETF approval serves as an example of "pent-up interest in crypto."

title: Ethereum (ETH) and Bitcoin (BTC) Prices Collapse After Stunning Rally - U.Today
summary: Ethereum and Bitcoin prices plummeted after a sudden rally, with $11.22 million worth of liquidations occurring in one hour on the Bitstamp exchange. The majority of these liquidations were evenly split between long and short positions. The crypto community is abuzz with speculation over the registration of the iShares Ethereum Trust in Delaware, which some see as a precursor to mainstream adoption and increased institutional investment in Ethereum. Meanwhile, there is growing momentum for a Bitcoin ETF in the United States, with some analysts predicting a "tsunami" of approvals by January 2024.

He believes that MATIC should be a top-10 crypto asset and is optimistic about layer-2 tokens, including MATIC and ARB. Despite being down 72% from 2021 highs, Adams thinks that MATIC has the potential for more gains in the next bull run. The coin is currently trending inside a bear trade range, but a comprehensive close above this level could signal the end of the bear run. title: BlackRock's Ethereum ETF Plan Is Confirmed in Nasdaq Filing - CoinDesk
summary: BlackRock, a leading investment management firm, has confirmed its plan to launch an Ethereum exchange-traded fund (ETF) through a filing with Nasdaq. The product, which will need regulatory approval, was registered in the state of Delaware under the name "iShares Ethereum Trust." This marks a significant development in the cryptocurrency market, as BlackRock's entry could lead to increased mainstream adoption and institutional investment in digital assets.

title: BlackRock Files Ethereum ETF Plan With Nasdaq - Unchained - Unchained
summary: BlackRock, a financial services giant, has filed a plan with Nasdaq to launch an Ethereum-based exchange-traded fund (ETF). The iShares Ethereum Trust would hold ether, the token of the Ethereum blockchain and second largest cryptocurrency by market capitalization. The product must still receive regulatory approval. BlackRock's interest in digital assets has been growing, with the company also filing an application for a spot bitcoin ETF with the Securities and Exchange Commission (SEC) in June. The news has driven ether prices up over 11% to trade at around $2,100, its highest level since mid-April.

title: BlackRock Officially Files Spot Ethereum ETF Application - Watcher Guru
summary: BlackRock, a $9 trillion asset manager, has officially filed for a Spot Ethereum ETF with Nasdaq. This comes after the company registered its iShares Ethereum Trust in Delaware. The ETF will need regulatory approval from the SEC, which has been resistant to approving spot crypto ETFs. BlackRock is confident that its Spot Bitcoin ETF application will be approved by the SEC by January 2024. The news has caused a potential jump in value for Ethereum, which is one of the top cryptocurrencies by trade volume and value.

title: BlackRock's spot Ethereum ETF plan is confirmed after Nasdaq filing - Cointelegraph
summary: BlackRock has confirmed its plans for a spot Ethereum exchange-traded fund (ETF) after submitting a 19b-4 form to the Securities and Exchange Commission (SEC). The $9-trillion asset management firm filed the form on behalf of the "iShares Ethereum Trust." This move signals BlackRock's intention to expand beyond Bitcoin with its ETF aspirations. At least five other firms are also in the running to win SEC approval for a spot Ether ETF, including VanEck, ARK 21Shares, Invesco, Grayscale, and Hashdex. The news has led to a price surge in ETH, which has clawed back some market dominance against BTC.

title: Ethereum Rockets Past $2,100 as BlackRock Files for Ethereum ETF with NASDAQ - Decrypt
summary: BlackRock has filed for an Ethereum ETF with NASDAQ, with the ticker symbol "ETH". The fund would allow investors to gain exposure to Ethereum's price movements without directly holding the asset. The filing comes after BlackRock registered a trust for Ethereum in Delaware and follows the SEC's approval of the first U.S. Bitcoin futures ETFs. Ethereum's price jumped 10% after the news, reaching $2,100, its highest level since April. The proposed ETF could potentially open the door for billions of dollars of new investment.

title: ETH sees price gains as Blackrock moves toward spot Ethereum ETF filing - AMBCrypto News
summary: Blackrock, a leading investment management firm, has filed for a spot Ethereum ETF application with the SEC, which has sparked a price rally in ETH. The coin has seen significant gains, breaching a key price level and registering an 8% increase in the past day. This move has also had a positive impact on the broader crypto market, with Bitcoin reaching its highest level of the year. The SEC has a short window to approve these applications, and if it doesn't make a move, it will have to decide by January 2024.

title: Countdown to Chaos: Ethereum Insider To Expose ETH Founders’ Fraud In Weeks - NewsBTC
summary: Steven Nerayoff, a former Ethereum advisor, has made explosive allegations of fraud against Ethereum founders Vitalik Buterin and Joseph Lubin. Nerayoff claims to have evidence of fraudulent activities within the Ethereum network and plans to release it in the coming weeks. He has already hinted at possible corrupt government officials involved with the Ethereum founders. The crypto community is closely watching the situation, with some skeptical of Nerayoff's claims. Nerayoff's legal team is working on publishing the evidence, and he has vowed to continue his pursuit of exposing Ethereum and its founders until justice is achieved. The ETH price has broken above $2,000, potentially signaling investor optimism despite the ongoing controversy.

title: BlackRock appears to take first steps toward an ether ETF - CNBC
summary: BlackRock, a leading asset management firm, has taken steps towards launching an ether ETF, according to a recent filing with the Delaware Division of Corporations. This move has sparked a rally in the cryptocurrency market, with ether's price surging 7% on Thursday. While the Securities and Exchange Commission (SEC) has not yet approved a bitcoin ETF, the recent court decision overturning the SEC's block on Grayscale's bitcoin trust product has created momentum for other bitcoin funds in the pipeline, including BlackRock's. If the SEC allows bitcoin ETFs, it is likely that ether funds would be next in line, given ether's popularity as the second most popular cryptocurrency behind bitcoin.

title: Ethereum Has Gone Deflationary Again—Here's Why and What It Means - Decrypt
summary: Ethereum has experienced a deflationary period since Monday, with the global supply contracting by over 4,700 ETH or $9.5 million. This is a significant change from the token's recent inflationary spiral. The increase in traffic on the Ethereum network has led to higher gas fees, which in turn have resulted in more ETH being "burned" by the network. NFT trading volume has also hit a three-month high, but analysts believe that this is not the sole reason for the deflation. Altcoins have been the main driver of the deflation, with numerous ETH-based tokens enjoying substantial rallies in the past week. Some analysts predict that this could signal that the bottom is in for Ethereum, but others warn that the token could be sandwiched between Bitcoin and more enticing risk-on altcoins.

title: BlackRock Files For iShares Ethereum ETF Trust in Delaware - Milk Road
summary: BlackRock, a financial giant, has filed for an Ethereum trust in Delaware, sparking speculation of an impending SEC application for an ETH ETF. BlackRock's registration follows a similar Bitcoin trust setup and suggests that the company may be preparing to submit an ETH ETF proposal soon. The move comes as Ether's real-world role in decentralized apps and services continues to grow, driving demand for ETH access among traditional investors. The news has led to a surge in ETH price, with the cryptocurrency trading at $2040 at press time. Analysts predict that the SEC could approve all bitcoin ETF applications simultaneously in a brief upcoming window, with both bitcoin and ether ETFs facing increasingly favorable prospects.
